chunks.chunk_text: This is a download from BBC Learning English.To find out more, visit our website.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Well, Pokemon started out as a video game series that turned into anime movies and trading cards, among other things.And in this programme we're talking about a video game character that is iconic, a word which means widely known and recognised.That character's name is Super Mario.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Now these days video games are everywhere and people of all ages enjoy playing them.There's also competitive e-sports events where gamers compete for what are often considerable amounts of money.Yes, and there are also streamers that appear on platforms like Twitch and YouTube who have become celebrities in their own right.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: I'm not sure about that.I can't remember him being in Pokemon, so I'll go for A, the Legend of Zelda.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: True, but it wasn't always that way.It's hard to imagine now, but in the 1980s the console market was struggling, particularly in the US.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: back then, especially in America, there had been a flood of games that were just not very high quality.One of the games that often cited as a factor in the collapse was this game called ICHI on the Atari, which was so bad that they ended up burying thousands of copies of it in the desert.Because nobody brought them, and so we'd had that especially in America.This didn't happen so much in Europe.But in America there had just been lots and lots of software.And none of it was all that great.There hadn't been anything really remarkable but there was a huge sub-movement.It would take you ten years to download those games from
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: 她用了sited, which means referenced or noted, when talking about the game ET being a reference for a factor in the collapse of the console market.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: A sudden period of growth.So as ET was mentioned, as a factor in the collapse, many people say that Super Mario Brothers was the reason that video games really took off, especially in the US.It's interesting to consider what might have been if his creator, Shigeru Miyamoto, had never created that character.The question is, why is that game so popular? What made it so fun to play?
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Hello, I'm Donald speaking again with Peter White on the BBC World Service programme You and Yours, explaining why Mario is just so popular and what makes the original game so satisfying to play.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: Kesa McDonald said that some games from 35 years ago are unplayable, so not possible to play them.But she said that Mario holds up, a term used to say that something's standards or quality has not lessened.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: I went for A, The Legend of Zelda.Ah, which is wrong, I'm afraid.Mario's first appearance was in Donkey Kong and his creator, Shigeru Miyamoto, never thought he would be that popular.Well, I guess we've already learnt something today.Let's recap
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: the vocabulary from today's programme about Super Mario, starting with iconic, famously associated with something and instantly recognisable.Then we had a flood of, which means a large amount of something in a short space of time.Cited means reference as or noted.Boom relates to explosion and means a short period of sudden growth.Unplayable describes something that can't be played or a game that is very difficult to enjoy.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json

chunks.chunk_text: And finally, holds up means that the quality or standards of something hasn't changed and still looks good or plays well.That's all for this programme.Bye for now.Bye.
chunks.original_filename: RSS_262026947_podcast_1304_Why is Super Mario so popular_.json
